com.caseyweed

Class Pile

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.caseyweed.Pile

  • public class Pile
extends java.lang.Object
    Pile will create a grid of images on a Graphics2D object. Using this we can add as many images as we have rows and columns to create a mosaic of images for export, display, or magic shows. The possibilities are truly limitless.
    Version:
    1.2
    Author:
    Casey Weed

    • Constructor Summary

      Create Pile object specifying the length, rows, columns, and images.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Pile

        public Pile(int rows,
            int cols,
            java.awt.image.BufferedImage[] images,
            boolean maintainAspectRatio)
     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create new Pile object based off the number of rows, columns, and image list. The longest side of the first image in the image list will be used to establish the grid cell size.
        Parameters:
        rows - Number of rows
        cols - Number of columns
        images - ArrayList of BufferedImages
        maintainAspectRatio - Whether or not to maintain the aspect ratio of images
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • Pile

        public Pile(int length,
            int rows,
            int cols,
            boolean maintainAspectRatio)
     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create Pile object based off lenght, rows, and columns. Image list is initially empty. Images can be added at will using addImage(BufferedImage) or set using setImages(ArrayList).
        Parameters:
        length - Length of grid cells
        rows - Number of rows
        cols - Number of columns
        maintainAspectRatio - Whether or not to maintain the aspect ratio of images
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        See Also:
        Pile(int, int, BufferedImage[], boolean), addImage(BufferedImage)

      • Pile

        public Pile(int length,
            int rows,
            int cols,
            java.awt.image.BufferedImage[] images,
            boolean maintainAspectRatio)
     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create Pile object specifying the length, rows, columns, and images.
        Parameters:
        length - Length of grid cells in pixels
        rows - Number of rows
        cols - Number of columns
        maintainAspectRatio - Whether or not to maintain the aspect ratio of images
        images - ArrayList of BufferedImages
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        See Also:
        Pile(int, int, BufferedImage[], boolean)

      • Pile

        public Pile(java.awt.image.BufferedImage[] images,
            boolean maintainAspectRatio)
        Specifying only a list of images will use the longest side of the first image as the length for all grid cells. The shape of the grid will be determined using the number of images closest to the nearest perfect square. If there are empty rows they will be removed.
        Parameters:
        images - ArrayList of BufferedImages
        maintainAspectRatio - Whether or not to maintain the aspect ratio of images

    • Method Detail

      • selfAdjust

        public void selfAdjust()
        Will perform the same adjustments seen here: Pile(BufferedImage[], boolean). Best used after adding or removing a number of images.

      • updateGraphics

        public void updateGraphics(boolean wrap,
                           boolean maintainAspectRatio)
        Update graphics (g), optionally wrapping through the images. For example, 0..10, restarts at index of 0 until grid is filled.
        Parameters:
        wrap - Whether or not to wrap

      • updateGraphics

        public void updateGraphics()
        Shortcut for updateGraphics(boolean, boolean) defaulted to false.

      • clearPile

        public void clearPile()
        Clear entire summary image to default color (Color.BLACK).

      • clearPile

        public void clearPile(java.awt.Color bg)
        Clear entire summary image to color specified (Color).
        Parameters:
        bg - Color to be used as background

      • addImage

        public void addImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
        Add image to the current image list, but only doing so if there is a valid number of openings available based on the grid size. For example, six images will not fit in a 2x2 grid, therefore the images are dropped.
        Parameters:
        image - Image to be added to the list

      • addImage

        public void addImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                     boolean update)
        Optionally update the summary image if specified.
        Parameters:
        image - Image to be added to the list
        update - Whether or not to update the summary image without wrapping.
        See Also:
        addImage(BufferedImage)

      • addImage

        public void addImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                     boolean update,
                     boolean wrap)
        Optionally update the summary image and wrap if specified.
        Parameters:
        image - Image to be added to the list
        update - Whether or not to update the graphics
        wrap - Whether or not to wrap the images
        See Also:
        addImage(BufferedImage)

        Parameters:
